alert.note: Alert for Webb (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 7:23AM CDT until September 06 at 12:20AM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south Texas, including the following county, Webb. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 723 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Laredo, Rio Bravo, El Cenizo, Orvil, Unitec Industrial Park, Doctors Hospital Of Laredo, Ranchos Penitas West, Laredo Country Club, Botines, Texas A&M, Laredo International Airport, St Augustine High School South Laredo, Laredo Community College, United South High School, Columbia Bridge, Las Tiendas and Ranchitos Las Lomas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
